title: Does white tattoo ink last? - Quora

response.answer_text: As it heals, white ink tattoos fade quickly , and they will either revert to your natural skin color or turn into a light grey or yellow. In fact, white ink tattoos often end up looking like decorative scar. It is not like doing a regular black ink tattoo.

Hello Andreas. White tattooing ink doesn’t last to long and fades away over time. I have one tattoo of a “”Pink Panther “ sitting in a champagne glass. The white has been re-colored twice. Lasting about 5 years. However, it depends on how your skin takes the ink, sun exposure and personal skin care. I live here in sunny California and do a lot of boating and camping often with the shirt off. I hope this helps?

For my skin, and where I live my white ink has lasted 10 years on my oldest tattoo and I still have white after years and months after my other tattoos. I am usually covered and not in the sun a whole lot(Washington State doesn't get a lot of sun anyways) and I'm always using sunscreen since I'm fair skinned. It all depends on how well you take care of the tattoo and your skin. There are also times where white pigment will discolor and either yellow or gray out.
